questiontext.text:
Exercise

Obtain the Fourier series of \[ f(t) = t \hspace{1cm} \pi \leq t \leq \pi \hspace{1cm} f(t + 2\pi) = f(t) \] and use it to find the answer to \( 1 - \dfrac{1}{3} + \dfrac{1}{5} - \dfrac{1}{7} + \dots\)

\( 1 - \dfrac{1}{3} + \dfrac{1}{5} - \dfrac{1}{7} + \dots = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
As \( f(t) \) is an odd function, \( a_n = 0 \). For \( b_n\) we have \[ \begin{align} b_n &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^\pi } t \sin nt \hspace{0.1cm} dt \\ &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \left( \left[ -\dfrac{t}{n} \cos nt \right]_{-\pi}^\pi + \dfrac{1}{n} \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^\pi } \cos nt \hspace{0.1cm} dt \right) \\ &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \left( -\dfrac{\pi}{n} \cos n \pi -\dfrac{\pi}{n} \cos n \pi + \dfrac{1}{n^2} \left[ \sin n\pi \right] _{-\pi}^\pi \right) \\ &= -\dfrac{2\cos n \pi}{n} \end{align} \] \[ = \begin{cases} -\dfrac{2}{n} \hspace{1cm} n = 2, 4, 6, \dots \\ \dfrac{2}{ni} \hspace{1cm} n = 1, 3, 5, \dots \end{cases} \] which can be expressed as \( \dfrac{-2(-1)^n}{n} \).

So the Fourier series is given by \[ f(t) =-2 \sum _{n=1}^\infty \dfrac{(-1)^n}{n} \sin nt \] Now setting \(t = \dfrac{\pi}{2} \) we have \(f(t) = \dfrac{\pi}{2}\). The Fourier series is \[ -2 \sum _{n=1}^\infty \dfrac{(-1)^n}{n} \sin \dfrac{n\pi}{2} \] which is equal to zero for even values of \(n\). Thus we have which can be rearranged to give \[ \begin{align} \dfrac{\pi}{2} &= -2 \sum _{n=1}^\infty \dfrac{(-1)^n}{n}\sin \dfrac{n\pi}{2} \\ &= 2 \left( 1 - \dfrac{1}{3} + \dfrac{1}{5} - \dfrac{1}{7} + \dots \right) \end{align} \] Thus \[ 1 - \dfrac{1}{3} + \dfrac{1}{5} - \dfrac{1}{7} + \dots  = \dfrac{\pi}{4} \]
